pageContent:
POOJ A SI NG H 
MASTER’S IN DATA SCIENCE |BACHELOR IN COMPUTER SCIENCE |PREDICTIVE ANALYTICS | 
DATA ENGINEERING |REAL ESTATE DATA ANALYTICS | DEEP LEARNING| NLP 
_i ̇† FURLONG, PA | 4454485034  MAIL.POOJASINGH11@GMAIL.COM 
 
 
Results-driven AI enthusiast with degrees in Data Science and Computer Science, boasting over five years of 
successfully delivering Data engineering, designing ETL jobs, advanced data solutions, and predictive analytics for 
prominent organizations. 
An enthusiastic contributor to the Python open-source community with a fervor for deep reinforcement learning. 
A forward-thinking individual with robust analytical prowess and a proven track record of employing diverse models, 
data processing, and data mining algorithms to address complex business challenges. 
Experienced Machine Learning Modeler with a proven track record of developing, deploying, and tuning highly effective 
predictive models for real business use cases, academic projects, and papers.

Experienced Machine Learning Modeler with a proven track record of developing, deploying, and tuning highly effective 
predictive models for real business use cases, academic projects, and papers. 
 
CORE COMPETENCIES 
 
Data Engineering: Data warehousing, ETL, Database Management, My SQL, AWS S3, AWS Glue, Lambda. 
Modeling: Logistic Regressions, Linear Regression, Decision Trees, Naïve Bayes, NLP (NLTK, Spark NLP, spacy), 
TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, NLP Classifier, KNN Classifier, Sentiment Analysis, Deep Neural Network (DNN), 
Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), n/w Flow Models (Transshipment and Max Flow Problems), Oversampling, 
Feature Engineering, Visualization, Statistical methods(hypothesis testing, A/B Testing, Descriptive Statistics, and 
Feature Selection (Embedded & Baruta). 
Programming: Python, HTML, CSS, SVG, JavaScript, D3.js; predictive modeling utilizing various Python packages,

Feature Selection (Embedded & Baruta). 
Programming: Python, HTML, CSS, SVG, JavaScript, D3.js; predictive modeling utilizing various Python packages, 
including Pandas, NumPy, Scikit learn, Seaborn, SciPy, Matplotlib; basic understanding of relational DBMS tools, 
including SQL, sqlite3, Excel VBA, Tableau 
Microsoft Office suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook 
EDUCATION 
 
New Jersey City University, Jersey City, NJ: 
Master of Science in Business Analytics and Data Science, 2023 GPA: 4.0/4.0 
 
Gyanchandji Hirachandji Raisoni College of Engineering, Nagpur: 
Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng.) in Computer Science, 2010 
 
 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
CASA Indian Homes Private Ltd (Real Estate and Infrastructure) Sep 2014 – June 2019 
Role: Data Engineer and Analyst (Team member of strategy and marketing team working for real estate 
Demand Forecasting and Pricing Data) 
Responsibility:

Role: Data Engineer and Analyst (Team member of strategy and marketing team working for real estate 
Demand Forecasting and Pricing Data) 
Responsibility: 
Data Warehousing, Data collection, Data cleaning, Data transformation and loading data on AWS AWS-based MySQL 
server. Real Estate Data collection and extraction from the Web (Web Scrapping), online property sites, API, Data 
Cleaning, preparation and Transformation(AWS Glue and Lambda), and storage (My SQL). Geographical, 
demographical, historical data, Financial Data 
Market research Data Management, Data Modeling for real estate demand forecasting, and pricing decision 
Projects: 
• New Construction price prediction modeling for the next five years of demand- Creating a predictive 
analytics model for real estate price forecasting.

• Developed a customer-centric demand forecasting model in Python, using precise customer segmentation to 
optimize marketing and resource allocation strategies, thus enhancing overall business performance and 
supply chain efficiency for a real estate company. 
 
 
 
Co-op/Internship Experience 
InclusionBridge July17-August11, 2023 
• Employed statistical approach for the in-depth analysis in the Commercialization IT Data Capabilities division, 
assessing the impact of ESG data on the financial client's “Predictive Trade Model”. 
• Performed meticulous evaluations encompassing critical input factors such as spread, liquidity, and volatility, 
as well as output metrics like trade impact. 
• Utilized a sophisticated array of correlation analysis methods, including both linear and non-linear approaches 
such as Pearson Correlation and Distance Correlation, alongside the computation of correlation P-values.

such as Pearson Correlation and Distance Correlation, alongside the computation of correlation P-values. 
These techniques unveiled intricate relationships between ESG components and trade impact, empowering 
data-driven trading decisions. 
• Implemented a distinct Statistical approach by investigating “Absolute Distance Correlation Differences” 
within ESG- ESG-stratified correlations, revealing evolving dependencies among variables across diverse 
ESG risk conditions. 
• Applied rigorous statistical validation, including P-values, to ascertain the significance of these differences. 
Steel Authority of India Limited, Bokaro, India, Sept- 2022 to Nov- 2022 
Role: Predictive analytics on Inventory management 
• Employed statistical models and data analysis techniques to discern patterns and trends within inventory data, 
enhancing forecasting precision and inventory management optimization and minimizing write-off and waste.

enhancing forecasting precision and inventory management optimization and minimizing write-off and waste. 
• Spearheaded the development of an advanced predictive inventory management model at Steel Authority of 
India Limited, offering a transformative approach. 
• Transformed the model into a versatile training tool, allowing teams to do scenario risk modeling across 
different inventory-level scenarios. 
• Introduced an efficient and data-driven methodology, replacing traditional, time-consuming approaches and 
revolutionizing inventory practices. 
• Established the model as an asset, enabling proactive risk mitigation, strategic planning, and more informed 
decision-making. 
Quantium July -2021 
Role: Virtual program Intern 
• Interned at Quantium as a Virtual Program Intern mainly focused on Data Preparation and Customer 
 Analytics, using experimentation and uplift testing analytics to uncover practical insights  
ACADEMIC PROJECTS AND PAPERS

Analytics, using experimentation and uplift testing analytics to uncover practical insights  
ACADEMIC PROJECTS AND PAPERS 
• Twitter NFT Sentiment Analysis: Earned distinction with an accepted and published paper at the esteemed 
49th Annual Northeast Business and Economics Association Conference, Employing API and web scraping 
techniques for meticulous data collection, adeptly addressing API limitations, centered around Python-driven 
sentiment analysis on Non-Fungible Tokens. 
• Multi Weather Classification (Deep Learning), Fall 2022: Successfully classified multi-weather conditions 
using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) and transfer learning, elevating test data accuracy from 
approximately 22% to approximately 81%. 
• Business Analyst Job Listing Analysis, Fall 2022: Engineered and executed a web-based interactive 
visualization and comprehensive report utilizing d3.js, HTML, and CSS.

• Business Analyst Job Listing Analysis, Fall 2022: Engineered and executed a web-based interactive 
visualization and comprehensive report utilizing d3.js, HTML, and CSS. 
• Student Dropout Prediction Challenge (3rd position in Kaggle Challenge), Spring 2022(course: 
Machine Learning) Evaluated classification techniques—Bagging, SVM, Random Forest, Stacking, and 
Logistic Regression—on NJCU students, constructing predictive models (R) for gauging the likelihood of 
student attrition. Transformed analyses into impeccably documented reports through R markdown. 
• Patient Procedure Information System for Hospital, Spring 2022(course: Developing Financial 
Software) Spearheaded the development of a menu-driven, object-oriented project for patient data 
management. Employed SQLite3 for SQL-Python integration and Inheritance for medical procedure cataloging. 
• Human Resource (HR) Employee Management System (course: Data Management), Spring 2022:

management. Employed SQLite3 for SQL-Python integration and Inheritance for medical procedure cataloging. 
• Human Resource (HR) Employee Management System (course: Data Management), Spring 2022: 
Created an encompassing HR database in MySQL for streamlined employee information management. 
• BAC & CITI Financial Valuation and Stock Analysis (course: Financial Modelling), Spring 2022: 
Employed Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) and Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC) evaluation methods in 
Excel for comprehensive stock analysis and valuation. Devised user-defined functions and automated 
processes via Excel VBA.
